Package world

Class LevelBuilder

java.lang.Object
world.LevelBuilder
public class LevelBuilder extends Object
Generates the bare outline of a level from the luminance values in an image. This class is a work in progress and may contain issues parsing non-regular image shapes or sizes.

Usage

This program is graphical and operates primarily using JOptionPanes. It can be run through the main game menu by clicking on the "Level Builder" button. The file can also be run directly through the public method, create which will graphically prompt the user for necessary inputs.

If enough information is already known about the conditions being used to generate the level, the completeGeneration method can be used. However, it is recommended that the create method be invoked instead to minimize the risk of pre-condition related exceptions.

Algorithm

The level builder determines the dimensions of one tile in terms of pixels from the width and height of the source image (by definition this is pxPerTileDim = imageDim / LEVEL_SIZE for a given dimension: width or height). Using this, the program loops through the image in sections of that many pixels. The average color of all the pixels in a pxPerTileWidth * pxPerTileHeight area is taken and compared against the LUMINANCE_THRESHOLD value specified in the command line arguments. If the average luminance is strictly greater than the threshold (or strictly less than the threshold if the reverse option is specified), a solid wall tile of the type provided is added, otherwise an empty tile is added.

  • Method Details

    • create

    • completeGeneration

      public static void completeGeneration(File file, int levelSize, String wall, String none, int luminanceThreshold, boolean invert)
      Performs the programatical operations to generate a level.
      Parameters:
      file - the file pointing to the source image that should be used to generate the level.
      levelSize - the size, square, of the level to generate.
      wall - the character that should be added to the level string if the luminance operation determines a given tile to be filled.
      none - the character that should be added to the level string if the luminance operation determines a given tile to be empty.
      luminanceThreshold - the minimum (or maximum if invert == true) average value that a group of pixels in the source image must have to be treated as a solid wall tile in the final image.
      invert - if true, pixel groups with an average luminance strictly less than luminanceThreshold are walls, otherwise groups strictly greater than luminanceThreshold are walls. That is, if invert == false, walls in the source image should be bright and if invert == true, walls in the source image should be dark.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if level is outside the interval [16, 256.
      NullPointerException - if wall == null.
      NullPointerException - if none == null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if luminanceThreshold is outside the interval [0, 255].
